page.title: 16LAW AND ORDER IN PENCOED
page.content: To-day policemen have to study the law and are taught many skills. They are taught first aid, rescue and how to defend themselves. Part of a policeman's job is to teach people how to prevent accidents and crime. They visit schools and teach children road safety, crime prevention and talk about police work. In our town we have three community policemen who are responsible for law and order. They get to know the public and give advice to organisations of all sorts. They are friendly faces in the town and people respect them. In l984 our community constables won the Shrievalty Cup for being the best team in the police authority. Our policemen also take cycling proficiency lessons in our school.
